setting.name: Channel
setting.description: Set/read the channel number (Uses 802.15.4 channel numbers).

setting.name: PAN ID
setting.description: Set the PAN (Personal Area Network) ID. Set ID = 0xFFFF to send message to all PANs.

setting.name: Destination Address High
setting.description: Set/read the upper 32 bits of the 64 bit destination address. Set the DH register to zero and DL less than 0xFFFF to transmit using a 16 bit address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN.

setting.name: Destination Address Low
setting.description: Set/read the lower 32 bits of the 64 bit destination address. Set the DH register to zero and DL less than 0xFFFF to transmit using a 16 bit address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN.

setting.name: 16-bit Source Address
setting.description: Set/read the 16-bit source address for the modem. Set MY = 0xFFFF to disable reception of packets with 16-bit addresses. 64-bit source address is the serial number and is always enabled.

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Read high 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit source address. 64-bit source address is always enabled.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Read low 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit source address. 64-bit source address is always enabled.

setting.name: MAC Mode
setting.description: Set/Read MAC Mode value. MAC Mode enables/disables the use of a MaxStream header in the 802.15.4 RF packet. When Mode 0 is enabled (MM=0 or 3), duplicate packet detection is enabled as well as certain AT commands. Modes 1 and 2 are strict 802.15.4 modes.

setting.name: XBee Retries
setting.description: Set number of retries the modem will execute in addition to the 3 retries provided by the 802.15.4 MAC. For each XBee retry, the 802.15.4 MAC can execute up to 3 retries.

setting.name: Random Delay Slots
setting.description: Set/Read the minimum value of the back-off exponent in the CSMA-CA algorithm that is used for collision avoidance. If RN = 0, collision avoidance is disabled during the first iteration of the algorithm (802.15.4 - macMinBE)

setting.name: Node Discover Time
setting.description: Set/read Node Discover Time register. This sets the maximum time for the Node Discover command.

setting.name: Node Discover Options
setting.description: Enable node discover self-response.

setting.name: Transmit Options
setting.description: Set/read transmit options for transparent mode: Bit0 - Disable MAC ACKs. Bit2 - Send to broadcast PAN ID. - All other bits must be set to 0

setting.name: 802.15.4 Compatibility
setting.description: Set/read 802.15.4 compatibility options. Options enabled when bits are set: bit0 - Transmit like legacy 802.15.4 at the cost of reduced throughput, bit1 - Do node discovry like 802.15.4 which locks out other AT commands longer than necessary

setting.name: Coordinator Enable
setting.description: Set/Read the coordinator setting: 0 - End Device, 1 - Coordinator.

setting.name: Scan Channels
setting.description: Read/set list of channels to scan for Active and Energy Scans as bitfield. Scans may be initiated by the ATAS, ATED commands and during End Device Association and Coordinator startup: Bit 15 - Ch. 0x1A . . . Bit 0 - Ch. 0x0B (bits 15, 14, 13 and 0 not available on XBee-PRO)

setting.name: Scan Duration
setting.description: Set read the Scan duration exponent. The exponent configures the duration of the active scan during association. Set End Device SD = BE of beaconing coordinator. Scan Time = N* (2 ^ SD) * 15.36ms. N=# channels: XBee = 16, XBee/Pro = 13.

setting.name: End Device Association
setting.description: Set/read End Device association options. Options enabled when bits are set: bit3 - Poll coordinator on pin wake, bit2 - Auto Associate, bit1 - Allow Channel reassignment, bit0 - Allow PanId reassignment.

setting.name: Coordinator Association
setting.description: Set/read Coordinator association options. Options enabled when bits are set: bit2 - Allow Association, bit1 - Allow Channel reassignment, bit0 - Allow PanId reassignment.

setting.name: Association Indication
setting.description: Read Association status code to monitor association progress.

setting.name: AES Encryption Enable
setting.description: Enables AES encryption

setting.name: AES Encryption Key
setting.description: Sets key used for encryption and decryption. This register can not be read.

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: Set/Read Node Identifier string

setting.name: Power Level
setting.description: Select/Read transmitter output power.

setting.name: Power Mode
setting.description: Select/Read module boost mode setting. If enabled, boost mode improves sensitivity by 2dBm and increases output power by 3dB, improving the link margin and range.

setting.name: CCA Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the Clear Channel Assessment (CCA) threshold. If the modem detects energy above the CCA Threshold, if will not transmit. The CCA parameter is measured in units of -dBm.

category.name: Sleep Modes (NonBeacon)
category.description: Configure low power options for NonBeacon systems

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Set/read sleep mode

setting.name: Time before Sleep
setting.description: Set/read time period of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before activating Sleep Mode. The ST parameter is used only with Cyclic Sleep settings (SM=4-5). Set ST on Cyclic Sleep Coordinator to match Cyclic Sleep Remotes

setting.name: Cyclic Sleep Period
setting.description: Set/read Cyclic sleep period for cyclic sleeping remotes. Set SP on Coordinator to match End Device. Coordinator will discard indirect messages after a period of 2.5*SP, set Coordinator SP = 0 to send direct messages. Maximum sleep period is 268 seconds (0x68B0).

setting.name: Disassociated Cyclic Sleep Period
setting.description: Set/read sleep period for cyclic sleeping remotes that are configured for Association but that are not associated to a Coordinator. Maximum sleep period is 268 seconds (0x68B0).

setting.name: Sleep Options
setting.description: Set/read sleep options. Bitfield options include: bit0 - Disables sending a wakeup poll request on devices configured for cyclic sleep sampling. bit1 - Suppresses sending ADC/DIO samples when waking from sleep (both cyclic sleep and pin sleep). All other option bits should be set to 0.

setting.name: Interface Data Rate
setting.description: Set/read the serial interface baud rate for communication between modem serial port and host. Request non-standard baud rates with values above 0x80 using a terminal window. Read BD register to find actual baud rate achieved.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: Configure parity for the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: Set/read number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: DIO7 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO7 line of the module. Options include: CTS flow control, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO6 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO6 line of the module. Options include: RTS flow control, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: Enables API mode.

setting.name: DIO0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO0 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: SPI_ATTN/AD1/DIO1 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the SPI_ATTN/AD1/DIO1 line of the module. Options include: SPI_ATTN,Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output

setting.name: SPI_SCLK/AD2/DIO2 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the SPI_SCLK/AD2/DIO2 line of the module. Options include: SPI slave clock input, Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: SPI_SSEL/AD3/DIO3 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the SPI_SSEL/AD3/DIO3 line of the module. Options include: SPI Slave select, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: SPI_MOSI/DIO4 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the SPI_MOSI/DIO4 line of the module. Options include: SPI Slave MOSI, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO5 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO5 line of the module. Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated),Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO8 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DI8 line of the module. Options include: Digital Input. This line is also used with Pin Sleep

setting.name: PWM0 Configuration
setting.description: Select/Read function for PWM0.

setting.name: PWM0 Duty Cycle
setting.description: The duty cycle of PWM0.

setting.name: PWM1 Configuration
setting.description: Select/Read function for PWM1.

setting.name: PWM1 Duty Cycle
setting.description: The duty cycle of PWM1.

setting.name: SPI_MISO/DIO12 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the SPI_MISO/DIO12 line of the module.

setting.name: Pull-up/down Resistor Enable
setting.description: Set/read bitfield to configure internal pull-up/down resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pull-up/down enabled, 0=no internal pull-up/down. Bitfield map: Bit 7 - DIN (P3), Bit 6 - DI8/SLEEP_RQ (P9), Bit 5 - DIO6/RTS (P16), Bit 4 - DIO0 (P20), Bit 3 - DIO1 (P19), Bit 2 - DIO2 (P18), Bit 1 - DIO3 (P17), Bit 0 - DIO4 (P11).

setting.name: Pull-up/down Direction
setting.description: Set/read resistor direction (1=pull-up, 0=pull-down) for corresponding I/O lines that are set in PR command. 1=internal pull-up, 0=internal pull-down. Bitfield map: Bit 7 - DIN (P3), Bit 6 - DI8/SLEEP_RQ (P9), Bit 5 - DIO6/RTS (P16), Bit 4 - DIO0 (P20), Bit 3 - DIO1 (P19), Bit 2 - DIO2 (P18), Bit 1 - DIO3 (P17), Bit 0 - DIO4 (P11).

setting.name: I/O Output Enable
setting.description: Enables I/O data received to be sent out UART. The data is sent using an API frame regardless of the current ATAP mode.

setting.name: Samples before TX
setting.description: Set/read number of samples to collect before transmission. The maximum number of samples is dependent on the number of enabled I/O lines.

setting.name: DIO Change Detect
setting.description: Set/Read bitfield values for change detect monitoring. Each bit enables monitoring of DIO0-DIO7 for changes. If detected, data is transmitted with DIO data only. Any samples queued waiting for transmission will be sent first.

setting.name: Sample Rate
setting.description: Set/read sample rate. When set this parameter causes the modem to sample all enabled DIO and ADC at a specified interval.

setting.name: PWM Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read output timeout value for both PWM outputs. When PWM is set to a non-zero value, due to I/O line passing, a time is started which when expired will set the PWM output to zero. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received.

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: Set/read PWM timer register. Set duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI pin (P6). The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet and is shut off when the timer expires.

setting.name: I/O Input Address
setting.description: Set/Read addresses of module to which outputs are bound. Setting all bytes to 0xFF will not allow any receive I/O packet to change outputs. Setting address to 0xFFFF will allow any received I/O packet to change outputs.

setting.name: D0 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received.

setting.name: D1 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received.

setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received.

setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received.

setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received.

setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received.

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read modem firmware version number.

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read modem hardware version number.

setting.name: Received Signal Strength
setting.description: Read signal level of last good packet received (RSSI) in dB (reports absolute value, eg. -88dBm = 0x58, accurate between -40 dBm to RX sensitivity).

setting.name: CCA Failures
setting.description: Reset/read count of Clear Channel Assessment (CCA) failures. This register increments when the modem does not transmit a packet because it detected energy above the CCA threshold level set with CA command. This count saturates at its maximum value. Set count to zero to reset count.

setting.name: ACK Failures
setting.description: Reset/read count of acknowledgment failures. This register increments when the modem expires the retries without receiving an ACK on a packet transmission. This count saturates at its maximum value. Set count to zero to reset count.

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: Read the device type identifier value.

setting.name: AT Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: Set/read command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, modem returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: Set required period of silence before, after and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: Set/read character value to be used to break from data mode to command mode. The default value <2Bh> is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character.
